request_pathways.name: Release of Information authorization form (HIPAA Form 3B)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a generic ROI authorization form from the Medical Records page, prints and completes it by hand, and submits via fax or in person.

red_flags: Missing expiration date/event and revocation instructions — required HIPAA authorization elements
Spanish form is ~8 years older than English version (2017 vs. 2025), risking outdated content for Spanish-speaking patients
bright_spots: Bilingual form availability (English and Spanish) — uncommon for a small rural critical access hospital
Website explicitly states records are free to patients requesting their own records
Well-organized 5-section structure (A–E) with granular 11-category record type selection

findability.rationale: Level 4: Form is easy to find via basic website navigation (Patients & Visitors → Medical Records), with direct PDF download links and clear contextual information about free patient access.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: No fillable fields despite being a digitally-authored PDF, requiring print-and-handwrite workflow, but fax submission is available via the number listed on the form header.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 5-section layout with clear headers, plain language, and granular record-type selection; minor issues include no 'all records' option, no date range selector, and no explicit submission instructions.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: Generic ROI form usable by patients but not designed for them — no 'patient access' purpose option, no delivery format choices, no patient rights language; patient must select 'Other' and figure out which fields apply.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No unnecessary barriers, free records for patients, appropriate special-category protections; minor gaps include missing expiration/revocation language on the form and fee information only on the website rather than the form itself.

overall.summary: Columbia Memorial Hospital provides an accessible, well-organized ROI process with commendable bilingual availability and fee transparency, but the generic authorization form, lack of fillable fields, and absence of a dedicated patient access pathway limit the patient experience.
